p: The cytotoxicity of the Plectranthus extracts was evaluated in MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells selected due to their availability, ease of manipulation and lack of studies of Plectranthus plant extracts in this cell line. All extracts at a concentration of 15 μg/mL showed low cytotoxicity towards MDA-MB-231 breast cancer cells ( Figure 2A). The most cytotoxic extract was the one obtained by maceration in acetone of P. madagascariensis (E5), with a reduction in cell viability of 20.13%, followed by the extract (E18) obtained by re-extraction in acetone of P. neochilus plant material previously extracted by SCFE (11.44% decrease in cell viability). The extract concentration producing 50% inhibition of cell viability (IC 50) was determined for the most active extract (E5) and a value of 64.52 μg/mL was found ( Figure 2B). This extract can thus be considered moderately cytotoxic [ 29] and was selected for further studies in other cancer cell lines, which are currently ongoing.
